content:
Translation: When we turned on the PC this morning, our drafts were gone; they were still there yesterday. They are no longer traceable. It's as if they've vanished. Is there a way to restore the drafts?

Sie könnten versuchen, den Entwürfe-Ordner zu reparieren. Klicken Sie mit der rechten Maustaste auf den Ordnernamen, wählen Sie "Eigenschaften", und klicken Sie dann auf "Ordner reparieren".

You could try repairing the drafts folder. Right click on the folder name, select Properties, then click on "Repair Folder".

Ist ein Schnellfilter eingestellt? Verwenden Sie eine Antivirensoftware?

Is a quick filter set? Are you using anti-virus software?
creator: mozilla98

content: You didn't specify which version you use. Thunderbird has an ESR version and a monthly version. The ESR has major updates annually, which would the version I would recommend for you. And, in settings>general, you can specify to NOT AUTOMATICALLY update, but let you decide. The download site is at https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ Finally, Thunderbird NEVER asks that the password change. When you do receive such a request, Thunderbird is only relaying that information from your email provider to you.

content: You may need to disable the experimental account hub first. You can go to Thunderbird Menu -> Settings -> Account hub and uncheck the "Create accounts in the new Account Hub" option to do this. Then, try to add the account again like normal and the "Configure manually" button should appear after entering an email address.

content: hello david, thanks, but it´s not about how many email accounts TB can handle. it´s about how many user accounts on one computer it can allow, if there is such a rule or limit. so for example it´s 3 users, all use this one computer. everytime one user logs in (to windows) at first TB is empty and the user can setup the connection to exchange. the first two users could do this but the third can not. thank you Andi
creator: andi.will.0175

content:
Thunderbird stores all of it's user data in the users %appdata% locations on windows , as you would know those are domain user dependent and access is not shared between users. So user 1 should not even have any data available for user 2 to even find. Unless you have installed Thunderbird using an administrator login and pointed the profile to somewhere other than the default locations for each user no user should have access the profile data of another.

So there could be a limit only in how many domain users can log into the computer (disk space for their remote and local data or memory if they are switching users.)
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hai un backup recente?

Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

content:
Non hai però risposto alla prima cosa che ti ho chiesto: hai un backup recente? Se non ne hai fatto uno, procedi adesso come spiegato qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

Inoltre, dato che usi POP3, tramite la webmail di Aruba la posta che non trovi in Thunderbird è ancora presente?

Dallo screenshot comunque non si capisce molto. Perché ti aspetti che le cartelle di Aruba siano sotto Cartelle locali? Quelle cartelle msgFilterRules inoltre fanno pensare che qualcosa abbia danneggiato il profilo di Thunderbird (hai controllato il log di Avast? hai percaso usato Avast CleanApp su Thunderbird?)

In base a queste risposte, poi vediamo cosa eventualmente si può fare.
creator: @next

content:
Il backup è stato fatto ma provando ad incollare la cartella Thunderbird the backup il problema persiste.

La webmail tramite Aruba è ancora presente e completa di tutte l'email.

Noi aspettiamo che le cartelle di Default " Poste in Arrivo, Poste Inviate e Cestino" siano presenti sotto la cartella " Cartelle Locali" - Questi sono sparite. Come anche molte altre cartelle da me create come sottocartelle per conservare l'email.

Avast non è stato utilizzato su Thunderbird, a meno che questo non abbiamo fatto una pulizia in automatico senza che io me ne accorgessi.

content:
There is an add-on for defining extra Local Folders:

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/localfolder/

Install it on multiple TB setups and create a common Local Folders.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Hi Mikael,

I rarely use threads, so I am no expert, and I do not know what may have changed over time. But I see in version 144.0.1 that data in the top message of a thread is undercored when there is an unread message in the thread. Do you see that?

I believe that threads are designed to sort in ascending chronological order at all times. That is their purpose: to show how discussions have flowed since the first message.

If you want to control sorting by date, you may want to use the conversations view. I keep a button for it on my main toolbar so I can access the conversation view for any discussion in one click.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird
creator: mozilla98

content: See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1442668#answer-1642934

content: I went into Thunderbird on my new PC, donated a few rand and went to "Install Thunderbird on Windows" - I get a Red circle with a red line through the middle with a comment "This content is blocked. Contact the site owner to fix this issue" - image attached What do I do now? Please help?
creator: Hephs007

content: - click the account in folder pane - rightclick and select 'subscribe' - untick the box for allmail (and also Important if that folder is ticked) The Allmail folder and Important folder are duplicates of your other folders. - after doing so, you can remove the now unneeded disk space by clicking help>troubleshootinginformmation, scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder', and then exiting thunderbird, and then clicking the imapmail folder, followed by clicking the Gmail account folder and then delete the allmail,allmail.msf, important, important.msf, and then restart thunderbird. :)
creator: davidsk

content: - click View>Folders> and tick 'folder pane header' - if menu bar is not visible, press the Alt key first

content:
The SMTP server settings are as follows, Server name: smtp.gmail.com Port: 465 Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: OAuth2 User name: name@gmail.com

Incoming mail settings probably don't matter, but they are Server name: imap.gmail.com Port: 993 Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: OAuth2 User name: name@gmail.com

content:
YC72 said
Hello, I am unable to create two different Orange accounts in Thunderbird since changing to a Windows 11 PC. It worked perfectly before with Windows 10. Thank you for your assistance. Kind regards,

First, disable account hub in Settings/General, then add the account from ≡ - New Account - Email.

Make sure you use a 3rd-party app password in place of the account password.

https://assistance.orange.fr/ordinateurs-peripheriques/installer-et-utiliser/l-utilisation-du-mail-et-du-cloud/mail-orange/le-mail-orange-nouvelle-version/parametrer-la-boite-mail/mail-orange-comment-acceder-a-sa-boite-mail-orange-depuis-une-application-ou-un-logiciel-de-messagerie-non-fourni-par-orange_434630-964290#
creator: sfhowes
